block.p: Dr. Leslie Altman Rescorla, a professor of psychology, and Dr. Thomas M. Achenbach, a professor of psychiatry and psychology, were married last evening at the Community Boathouse in Burlington, Vt. The Rev. Roddy O'Neil Cleary, a Unitarian Universalist minister, performed the nondenominational ceremony.

Dr. Rescorla, 54, is keeping her name. She is the chairwoman of the psychology department and director of the Child Study Institute at Bryn Mawr College in Bryn Mawr, Pa. She graduated magna cum laude from Radcliffe College and received a master's degree in economic history from the London School of Economics and a Ph.D. in psychology from Yale University.

Dr. Leslie Altman Rescorla, a professor of psychology, and Dr. Thomas M. Achenbach, a professor of psychiatry and psychology, were married last evening at the Community Boathouse in Burlington, Vt. The Rev. Roddy O'Neil Cleary, a Unitarian Universalist minister, performed the nondenominational ceremony.

Dr. Rescorla, 54, is keeping her name. She is the chairwoman of the psychology department and director of the Child Study Institute at Bryn Mawr College in Bryn Mawr, Pa. She graduated magna cum laude from Radcliffe College and received a master's degree in economic history from the London School of Economics and a Ph.D. in psychology from Yale University.

Dr. Achenbach, 59, teaches at the University of Vermont in Burlington, where he is also the director of the Center for Children, Youth and Families. He graduated summa cum laude from Yale and received a Ph.D. in psychology from the University of Minnesota at Minneapolis. He is a son of the late Mary and Hans Achenbach of Wethersfield, Conn.
The bride's previous marriage ended in divorce, as did the bridegroom's.
